N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 830.3 - System of penalties

State Regulations
(a) The employer is notified of a violation by the commissioner by issuance of a
notice of violation and order to comply, which fixes a reasonable abatement
date for each violation. (b) If an
employer fails to abate a violation by the abatement date, penalties are
assessed by the commissioner by issuing a notification of failure to abate
which establishes the amount of the penalty to be assessed for each day until
the compliance date. (c) Pursuant
to Labor Law, section 27-a(6), an employer who fails to correct a nonserious
violation by the abatement date may be assessed a civil penalty of up to $50
per day until the compliance date. An employer who fails to correct a serious
violation by the abatement date may be assessed a civil penalty of up to $200
per day until the compliance date. Notes
